item.title: Should 'High CPU Load' Trigger an Alert?
Should upper-layer businesses receive alarms from underlying infrastructure?
item.description: A friend asked: I am a DEV or SRE of a business application. My application depends on underlying services and infrastructure, such as basic networks, Kubernetes, MySQL, and cash register services. Should I receive alarms if these basic services have problems? There is a subscription rule in Nightingale. Is it designed for this purpose? This article presents the author’s personal understanding, for reference only.
